text.content: Integral probability metric: metric measures the divergence between two distributions

rich_text.plain_text: Integral probability metric: metric measures the divergence between two distributions

equation.expression: \text{IPM}_{\mathscr F}(p_1,p_2)=\max_{f\in\mathscr F}\left[\mathbb E_{x\sim p_1}f(x) - \mathbb E_{x \sim p_2} f(x)\right]\\\mathscr F = \{f:\|f\|_\infty\le1\}\implies \text{IPM}_{\mathscr F}:=\|p_1-p_2\|_{tv}\\\mathscr F = \{f:\|f \text{ is 1-Lipschitz}\}\implies \text{IPM}_{\mathscr F}:=\text{wasserstein dis}(p_1,p_2)

equation.expression: f_{\pi,\pi'}=\argmax_{f\in\mathscr F}\left[\mathbb E_{s,a\sim d^\pi}f(s,a)-\mathbb E_{s,a \sim d^{\pi'}}f(s,a) \right]
